intro: Triumfetta lappacea, commonly known as the hairy triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, clustered in small inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Triumfetta lappacea is adapted to various soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
